intro: Lithocarpus conocarpus subsp. malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca stone oak, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its hard, woody fruits and evergreen leaves. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in Malaysia and parts of Indonesia. The plant typically grows in lowland and hill forest environments, often in humid, shaded conditions. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and have a deep green color, while the nuts are enclosed in a thick, woody cupule. This species is valued for its durable timber and plays a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various wildlife.
